    –ö–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞ –õ–ê–ù–ò–¢-–ò–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –≤–∫–ª—é—á–∞–µ—Ç –≤ —Å–µ–±—è –±–æ–ª–µ–µ 700 —Å–µ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤. –ü–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–Ω–æ –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∞—è —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞ –ø–æ–≤—ã—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫–≤–∞–ª–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏, –≤ —Ç–æ–º —á–∏—Å–ª–µ –∏ –≤ —É—á–µ–±–Ω—ã—Ö —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö –≤–µ–Ω–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤, –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è—é—Ç –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑–º —Å–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ –Ω–∞ —Å–∞–º–æ–º –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫–æ–º —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ. –ü–æ–∑–∏—Ç–∏–≤, –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑–º –∏ –Ω–µ—É–±—ã–≤–∞—é—â–∏–π –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å –∫ –ò–¢-—Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—è–º ‚Äì —ç—Ç–æ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã–µ —Ü–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞—à–µ–π –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã.

    –ù–∞—à–∏ –æ–∂–∏–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è:

    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–π Microsoft (Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, SCCM, SQL, SharePoint, Exchange, Hyper-V, Power BI, Microsoft 365 / Office 365 (Teams, –∑–∞—â–∏—Ç–∞ –∏ —Ç.–¥.);

    • –ü–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–æ–≤ –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–∏—è —á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö / –≥–∏–±—Ä–∏–¥–Ω—ã—Ö –æ–±–ª–∞–∫–æ–≤;

    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–æ–π: –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∫–∞ –∏ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª—å –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –∑–∞–¥–∞—á, –∫–æ–æ—Ä–¥–∏–Ω–∞—Ü–∏—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç;

    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–Ω–æ–π –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–µ–π, –æ—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ –ì–û–°–¢.

    –í–∞—à–∏ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏:

    • –ü—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –∏ –≤–Ω–µ–¥—Ä—è—Ç—å —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è;

    • –û–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫—É—é –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫—É –ø–æ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã–º –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–µ–∫—Å–Ω—ã–º –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞–º;

    • –ü—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä—è—Ç—å –∏ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –Ω–æ–≤—ã–µ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ –¥–µ–º–æ-–ª–∞–±–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏;

    • –ö–æ–Ω—Å—É–ª—å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –∑–∞–∫–∞–∑—á–∏–∫–æ–≤ –ø–æ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–º —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è–º;

    • –†–∞—Å—à–∏—Ä—è—Ç—å —Å–≤–æ–π –∫—Ä—É–≥–æ–∑–æ—Ä –≤ –Ω–æ–≤—ã—Ö –∏ –ø–µ—Ä—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã—Ö –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è—Ö –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –∏ –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª–∞ (cloud / devops /–≥–∏–ø–µ—Ä–∫–æ–Ω–≤–µ—Ä–≥–µ–Ω—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å).

    –ú—ã –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–∞–≥–∞–µ–º:

    • –°—Ç–∞–±–∏–ª—å–Ω–∞—è –∑–∞—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω–∞—è –ø–ª–∞—Ç–∞ + —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞ –º–æ—Ç–∏–≤–∞—Ü–∏–∏;

    • –ì–∏–±—Ä–∏–¥–Ω—ã–π —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã: 1-2 –¥–Ω—è –≤ –Ω–µ–¥–µ–ª—é —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞ –≤ –æ—Ñ–∏—Å–µ, –æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞;

    • –°–æ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –ø–∞–∫–µ—Ç (–º–µ–¥–∏—Ü–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∞—è —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö–æ–≤–∫–∞, –∫–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–µ —Å–∫–∏–¥–∫–∏ –Ω–∞ –ø–æ—Å–µ—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ñ–∏—Ç–Ω–µ—Å-—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–∞);

    • –ù–∞ —Ç–µ—Ä—Ä–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏ –æ—Ñ–∏—Å–∞ —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω—ã –∫—É—Ö–Ω–∏, —Å—Ç–æ–ª–æ–≤–∞—è, –∫–∞—Ñ–µ –∏ –∫–æ—Ñ–µ–π–Ω—ã–π –∫–∏–æ—Å–∫;

    • –û–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –∏ —Å—Ç–∏–º—É–ª–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç—Å—è: –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ–µ –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ–ø–ª–∞—á–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è, —Å–µ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏—è –ø–æ–æ—â—Ä—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø—Ä–µ–º–∏—è–º–∏ –ø–æ —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–∞–º —Å–¥–∞—á–∏ —ç–∫–∑–∞–º–µ–Ω–æ–≤;

    • –í–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏ –∫–∞—Ä—å–µ—Ä–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∞;

    • –¢–µ—Ä—Ä–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –º. –†–∏–∂—Å–∫–∞—è/–º. –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ–µ–≤—Å–∫–∞—è/–º. –ú–∞—Ä—å–∏–Ω–∞ —Ä–æ—â–∞ (–∫–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–π —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç).


  180. –†—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤ (–ú–µ–∂–¥—É–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥–Ω—ã–π –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å) ("–ü–æ—á—Ç–æ–≤—ã–µ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏", –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–∞) [ 2021-08-20 ]
    ...–æ–≥–æ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è; –ì–∏–±–∫–∏–π –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫ –∏ —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—É—é —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É; –ö–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä–µ–Ω—Ç–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä...

    –ö–∞–∫–∏–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏ –∂–¥—É—Ç –∏–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ —Ç–µ–±—è:

    • –£–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø—É–ª–æ–º IT-–ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –±–ª–æ–∫–∞, –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –∑–∞ –∏—Ö —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç—ã,
    • –£–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ–∂–∏–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è–º–∏ –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–∑–∞–∫–∞–∑—á–∏–∫–æ–≤, –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∫—Ä–∏—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–µ–≤ —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤,
    • –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–∞ —Å–±–æ—Ä–∞, –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞ –∏ –æ—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π –∫ –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–º —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞–º "–ü–æ—á—Ç—ã –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏",
    • –£—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ –≤ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—è—Ö –±–ª–æ–∫–∞ –≤ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è IT, –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏ –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏, –æ—Ü–µ–Ω–∫–∞ —Ç—Ä—É–¥–æ–∑–∞—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç, –ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç,
    • –£—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ –≤ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ —Ä–∞–±–æ—á–∏—Ö –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤, –≤—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç –≤–Ω–µ—à–Ω–∏—Ö –∏ –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–∏—Ö –∫–æ–º–º—É–Ω–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏,
    • –ê–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–µ —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ –≤ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –∏ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ/—É–ª—É—á—à–µ–Ω–∏–∏ IT-–ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –∏ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–æ–≤,
    • –ù–µ–ø–æ—Å—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–µ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ö–æ–¥–æ–º –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤, –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª—å —Å—Ä–æ–∫–æ–≤, —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–∏—Å–∫–∞–º–∏,
    • –†–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–Ω–æ–π –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏, —Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–∏ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã, —Å –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–∑–∞–∫–∞–∑—á–∏–∫–æ–º –∏ –≤–Ω–µ—à–Ω–∏–º–∏ –ø–æ–¥—Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è–º–∏.

    –ú—ã –∂–¥–µ–º —á—Ç–æ —É —Ç–µ–±—è –µ—Å—Ç—å:

    • –û–ø—ã—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–Ω–æ–π –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ –∏ –≤–Ω–µ–¥—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –ü–û –Ω–µ –º–µ–Ω–µ–µ 3 –ª–µ—Ç,
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç –≤—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π —Å –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–∑–∞–∫–∞–∑—á–∏–∫–∞–º–∏, –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞–º–∏ –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–º–∏ –ø–æ–¥—Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è–º–∏ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏, –≤–ª–∏—è—é—â–∏–º–∏ –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç,
    • –ì–æ—Ç–æ–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–µ–æ–¥–æ–ª–µ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Å–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –∞—Ä–≥—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ –æ—Ç—Å—Ç–∞–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å —Å–≤–æ–µ –º–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ,
    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏/—Ñ—Ä–µ–π–º–≤–æ—Ä–∫–∏ , –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å –∫–∞–∫ –≤ Agile, —Ç–∞–∫ –∏ Waterfall,
    • –ò–º–µ–µ—Ç –≤—ã—Å—à–µ–µ –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≤ —Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ IT –∏–ª–∏ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è,
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–Ω—ã–º –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–æ–º, –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è, —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–æ–º (–∫–∞–∫ –Ω–µ—Å–æ–º–Ω–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–µ–∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ),
    • –í–ª–∞–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–º —è–∑—ã–∫–æ–º –Ω–∞ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ Intermediate,
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞–º–∏ –≤ –ª–æ–≥–∏—Å—Ç–∏–∫–µ (–∫–∞–∫ –Ω–µ—Å–æ–º–Ω–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–µ–∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ),
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–Ω—ã–º –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–æ–º, –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è, —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–æ–º (–∫–∞–∫ –Ω–µ—Å–æ–º–Ω–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–µ–∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ).

    –ú—ã —Ä–∞–¥—ã –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–∏—Ç—å:

    • –í–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ—è–≤–∏—Ç—å —Å–µ–±—è –≤ —Å–æ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ-–∑–Ω–∞—á–∏–º—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞—Ö —Ñ–µ–¥–µ—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è;
    • –ì–∏–±–∫–∏–π –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫ –∏ —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—É—é —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É;
    • –ö–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä–µ–Ω—Ç–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ –∑–∞—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω–æ–π –ø–ª–∞—Ç–µ –∏ –µ–∂–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–µ–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ;
    • –î–ú–° —Å–æ —Å—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–µ–π, —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –≤—ã–µ–∑–¥–∞ –∑–∞ —Ä—É–±–µ–∂ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —Ç—Ä–µ—Ö –º–µ—Å—è—Ü–µ–≤ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –≤ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏;
    • –õ—å–≥–æ—Ç–Ω–æ–µ –∫—Ä–µ–¥–∏—Ç–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≤ –ü–æ—á—Ç–∞–±–∞–Ω–∫–µ –∏ —Å–∫–∏–¥–∫–∏ —É –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–π-–ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–æ–≤ (—Ñ–∏—Ç–Ω–µ—Å, —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ, –ø—É—Ç–µ–≤–∫–∏ –æ—Ç —Ç—É—Ä–æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≤);
    • –ü–æ–ª–Ω–æ–µ —Å–æ–±–ª—é–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –¢–ö –†–§;
    • –ú–µ–Ω—Ç–æ—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–æ –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–∏ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥, –¥—Ä—É–∂–µ–ª—é–±–Ω–∞—è –∞—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–∞, –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–æ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏–≤–∞—é—â–∏–µ—Å—è —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –ø–æ —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–∏–∑–∞–º (Java, frontend, iOS, Android, devOps, design, QA)
    • Demo-–¥–Ω–∏ –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –º–µ—Å—è—Ü.


  181. DevOps –∏–Ω–∂–µ–Ω–µ—Ä ("–ò–¶ –ê–ô-–¢–ï–ö–û", –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–∞) [ 2021-08-20 ]
    ...∞—Ñ–∏–∫ + –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ; –ò—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å–∞–º—ã—Ö —Å–æ...

    –ö–û–ú–ü–ê–ù–ò–Ø ¬´–ê–ô-–¢–ï–ö–û¬ª - –≤–µ–¥—É—â–∏–π —Ä–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–Ω—ã–π –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä –∏ –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤—â–∏–∫ –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–π –¥–ª—è –∫–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–∞–∫–∞–∑—á–∏–∫–æ–≤. –ê–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—Ç –Ω–∞ —Ä—ã–Ω–∫–µ IT –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ —Å 1997 –≥–æ–¥–∞, –≤—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –≤ –¢–û–ü-400 –∫—Ä—É–ø–Ω–µ–π—à–∏—Ö —Ä–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–∏—Ö –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–π, –¢–û–ü-10 –∫—Ä—É–ø–Ω–µ–π—à–∏—Ö IT-–∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–π –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏.

    –í —Å–≤—è–∑–∏ —Å –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–º —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏–µ–º —É –Ω–∞—Å –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∞ –≤–∞–∫–∞–Ω—Å–∏—è DEVOPS ENGINEER –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–µ –•5 –†–∏—Ç–µ–π–ª –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø.

    –ó–ê–î–ê–ß–ò:

    • –†–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∏ –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑ –∫–æ—Ä–Ω–µ–≤—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–∏—á–∏–Ω –∏–Ω—Ü–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –∏ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º, —Å–≤—è–∑–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–æ —Å—Ç–∞–±–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –∏ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é;
    • –í–Ω–µ–¥—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∏ –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π–∫–∞ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –æ—Ç–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏ –∏ –æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–π —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—ã –ê–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è —Å–±–æ—Ä–∫–∏, —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è, —Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ—Ä—Ç—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–æ–≤;
    • –£—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ –≤ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ/–¥–æ—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—ã (—Å–æ–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ —Å –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—ã), —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π –∫ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä–∞–º –∏ —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–Ω–æ–º—É –ü–û;
    • –ö–æ–º–º—É–Ω–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏—è —Å –∑–∞–∫–∞–∑—á–∏–∫–∞–º–∏ –∏ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∞–º–∏ –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏—è, –ø—Ä–∏–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –∏ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –∑–∞–¥–∞—á –¥–ª—è –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫–æ–Ω–≤–µ–π–µ—Ä–∞ –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–µ—Ä—ã–≤–Ω–æ–π –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∫–∏ –£—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ –≤ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ —Ä–µ–ª–∏–∑–Ω—ã—Ö –ø–æ–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫ –∏ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–µ–≥–∏–π —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–∞ DevOps;

    –¢–†–ï–ë–û–í–ê–ù–ò–Ø:

    • –û–ø—ã—Ç –∞–¥–º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è Linux –∏ Windows-—Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç –∞–¥–º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –±–∞–∑ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏—è SQL-–∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ—Å–æ–≤;
    • –ù–∞–≤—ã–∫–∏ –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏—è —Å–∫—Ä–∏–ø—Ç–æ–≤ –Ω–∞ bash / shell / python;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–æ–π –æ—Ä–∫–µ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏ Kubernetes / OpenShift –û–ø—ã—Ç –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ CI/CD: Jenkins / Gitlab CI –∏ –¥—Ä.;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞–º–∏ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–µ–π (–º—ã –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ–º Ansible) –ê–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π –Ω–µ –Ω–∏–∂–µ Intermediate;
    • –ü–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å–µ—Ç–µ–≤–æ–≥–æ —Å—Ç–µ–∫–∞ (–º–æ–¥–µ–ª—å OSI –∏ —Å—Ç–µ–∫ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–æ–∫–æ–ª—ã TCP/IP), –°–•–î, –±–∞–∑–æ–≤—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–æ–≤ (AD, DNS, DHCP, NTP –∏ —Ç.–¥.);
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç –∞–¥–º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è Windows –∏–Ω—Ñ—Ä–∞—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã, –≤–∫–ª—é—á–∞—è AD, IIS, DNS, MS SQL –û–ø—ã—Ç –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –æ—Ç–∫–∞–∑–æ—É—Å—Ç–æ–π—á–∏–≤–æ–π –∏ –∫–∞—Ç–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ—Ñ–æ—É—Å—Ç–æ–π—á–∏–≤–æ–π –∏–Ω—Ñ—Ä–∞—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞;

    –ü–†–û –ù–ê–®–ò –£–°–õ–û–í–ò–Ø:

    • –û—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ —Ç—Ä—É–¥–æ—É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–æ;

    • –ì–∏–±–∫–∏–π —Ä–∞–±–æ—á–∏–π –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫ + –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ;

    • –ò—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å–∞–º—ã—Ö —Å–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–π –≤ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ;

    • –ü–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –±–µ–ª–∞—è –∑–∞—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω–∞—è –ø–ª–∞—Ç–∞ 2 —Ä–∞–∑–∞ –≤ –º–µ—Å—è—Ü (–æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø–æ —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–∞–º –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–≤—å—é);

    • –ê–¥–µ–∫–≤–∞—Ç–Ω–æ–µ –∏ –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–æ–µ —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–æ;

    • –ö–∞—Ä—å–µ—Ä–Ω—ã–π —Ä–æ—Å—Ç, –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —Ä–∞—Å—Ç–∏ –∏ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ —Ä–∞–º–∫–∞—Ö –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏;
    • –î–ú–° —Å–æ —Å—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–µ–π –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –∑–∞ —Å—á—ë—Ç –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏;
    • –û–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ/—Å–µ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏—è –∑–∞ —Å—á—ë—Ç –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏;


  182. –°–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–Ω—ã–π –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫ ("–°–±–µ—Ä–±–∞–Ω–∫", –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–∞) [ 2021-08-20 ]
    ...Å–∫–∞—è/ –ù–∞–≥–∞—Ç–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∞—è, –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–∞ —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∫–∞ –î–ú–°, —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –æ—Ç –Ω–µ—Å—á–...

    –ú—ã ‚Äì –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞, —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞—é—â–∞—è —Ü–µ–ª–µ–≤—É—é —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—É –ê–° ¬´–ö–∞—Å—Å–æ–≤—ã–π —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä¬ª! –ù–∞—à–∞ –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫–æ–Ω–∞–≥—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è 24/7 business-critical –ê–° —É—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∞ –≤–æ –≤—Å–µ—Ö –ö–∞—Å—Å–æ–≤—ã—Ö –¶–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö –°–±–µ—Ä–∞ –ø–æ –≤—Å–µ–π —Ç–µ—Ä—Ä–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏. –ß–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –Ω–∞—Å –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç –≤—Å–µ –¥–µ–Ω–µ–∂–Ω—ã–µ (–∏ –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ) –ø–æ—Ç–æ–∫–∏ –æ—Ç –∫–ª–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ (–Æ—Ä–∏–¥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ª–∏—Ü–∞, –§–∏–Ω–∞–Ω—Å–æ–≤—ã–µ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—É—Ç—ã, –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ–¥—Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –°–±–µ—Ä–∞, –±–∞–Ω–∫–æ–º–∞—Ç—ã –∏ –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏–µ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–µ) –≤ –ö–∞—Å—Å–æ–≤—ã–µ —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä—ã –∏ –æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç–Ω–æ. –ú—ã –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏–∑–∏—Ä—É–µ–º —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É –ö–∞—Å—Å–æ–≤—ã—Ö —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–≤, –∏–Ω–∫–∞—Å—Å–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≤, —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è–µ–º –ø–æ—Ç–æ–∫–∞–º–∏ –Ω–∞–ª–∏—á–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏ —Ü–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π (—Ä—É–±–ª–∏, –≤–∞–ª—é—Ç–∞, —Å–ª–∏—Ç–∫–∏, –º–æ–Ω–µ—Ç—ã –∏–∑ –¥—Ä–∞–≥–æ—Ü–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –º–µ—Ç–∞–ª–ª–æ–≤), —Ä–µ—à–∞–µ–º –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏ –æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –ª–∏–∫–≤–∏–¥–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω—ã —Å –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–º –∫–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º –±–∞–Ω–∫–∞, –ø—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º —è–≤–ª—è–µ–º—Å—è –æ–¥–Ω–æ–π –∏–∑ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã—Ö. –ù–∞—à –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø—É—Ç–µ–º –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥–∞ –Ω–∞ –º–∏–∫—Ä–æ—Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–Ω—É—é –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä—É —Å –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º —Å–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–µ–π —Å –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–æ–π –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–æ–π –°–±–µ—Ä–∞ ‚Äì –ü–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞ –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏—è –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å–∞. –ú—ã –∏–º–µ–µ–º –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Ü–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫–æ–∫–≤–∞–ª–∏—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏, –≤ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–π –∏–∑ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö –µ—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–π ‚Äì –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∏, —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∏, —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç—ã –ø–æ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–º—É –∏ –∞–≤—Ç–æ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é, devops, –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–æ–≤—ã–µ –º–µ–Ω–µ–¥–∂–µ—Ä—ã.

    –ú—ã –∏—â–µ–º ‚Äì —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∞, –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –æ—Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–ª—è—Ç—å —Å–±–æ—Ä –∏ —á–µ—Ç–∫–æ –æ–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è, –æ—Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–ª—è—Ç—å –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∫—É –∑–∞–¥–∞—á –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–µ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–æ–≤.

    –û–±—è–∑–∞–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏:

    • –°–±–æ—Ä, –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑, –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ;
    • –°–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π —Å –∑–∞–∫–∞–∑—á–∏–∫–æ–º, —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–æ–º –∏ –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∞–º–∏;
    • –°–∫–≤–æ–∑–Ω–∞—è –∫–æ–º–º—É–Ω–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏—è —Å –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∞–º–∏ —Å–º–µ–∂–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º –Ω–∞ –≤—Å–µ—Ö —ç—Ç–∞–ø–∞—Ö —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞;
    • –ö–æ–Ω—Å—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏ —á–ª–µ–Ω–æ–≤ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã;
    • –ö–æ–Ω—Å—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –ø–æ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏;

    –¢—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è:

    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ–π —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –ò–¢-–∑–∞–¥–∞—á –≤ —Ä–æ–ª–∏ –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –æ—Ç 3-—Ö –ª–µ—Ç;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –≤ –∫—Ä—É–ø–Ω—ã—Ö –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è—Ö;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –≤ –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç–∏ —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –±–∞–Ω–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤;
    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–æ–≤ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —É—á–µ—Ç–∞ –∏ –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏/–∏–ª–∏ —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–Ω—Å–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è;
    • –£–≤–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å MS Office (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint);
    • –ü–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏ Agile, –∏–ª–∏ Scrum, –∏–ª–∏ Kanban.
    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ UML –∏ BPMN –Ω–æ—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–π;
    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤ –±–∞–∑ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∏ SQL –Ω–∞ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ã—Ö –∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ—Å–æ–≤;
    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –ü–û;
    • –ë–∞–∑–æ–≤—ã–µ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –ø–æ XML –∏–ª–∏ JSON;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–π —Å –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º MQ, REST –∏–ª–∏ SOAP;
    • –ü—Ä–æ—Ç–æ—Ç–∏–ø–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∏ –æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏–µ –º–∞–∫–µ—Ç–æ–≤ GUI;

    –ë—É–¥–µ—Ç –ø–ª—é—Å–æ–º

    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ JIRA, Confluence;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –∏–ª–∏ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –±–∞–Ω–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –ü–û;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å SoapUI, Postman, Hermes, JMS Browser;

    –£—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è:

    • –ú–µ—Å—Ç–æ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –≤ —Ä–∞–π–æ–Ω–µ –º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ –ö–æ–ª–æ–º–µ–Ω—Å–∫–∞—è/ –ù–∞–≥–∞—Ç–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∞—è, –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–∞ —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∫–∞
    • –î–ú–°, —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –æ—Ç –Ω–µ—Å—á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–ª—É—á–∞–µ–≤
    • –ú–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å –∏ —Å–æ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫–∞, –∫–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–∞—è –ø–µ–Ω—Å–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞, –ª—å–≥–æ—Ç–Ω—ã–µ —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç—ã –°–±–µ—Ä–∞, —Å–∫–∏–¥–∫–∏ –æ—Ç –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–π-–ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–æ–≤
    • –í–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–µ–µ –∏ –≤–Ω–µ—à–Ω–µ–µ –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ, Bootcamp


  183. –°–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–Ω—ã–π –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä ("–ò–Ω–Ω–æ—Ç–µ—Ö, –ì—Ä—É–ø–ø–∞ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–π", –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–∞) [ 2021-08-19 ]

    –ì–ö –ò–Ω–Ω–æ—Ç–µ—Ö ‚Äì –æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –ø–æ–ª–Ω—ã–π —Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç—Ä —É—Å–ª—É–≥ –ø–æ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ –ü–û –¥–ª—è —Ü–∏—Ñ—Ä–æ–≤–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –±–∞–Ω–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–π –æ—Ç—Ä–∞—Å–ª–∏ –∏ —É–≤–µ–ª–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–π —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å–∞ –±–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥–∞—Ä—è –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–æ–≤—ã—Ö —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–π.
    –ù–∞—à–∞ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç—ã –≤ –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç–∏ —Ä–µ—á–µ–≤–æ–π –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∏, –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –∞—Å—Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≤ –ö–¶.

    –ü—Ä–∏—Å–æ–µ–¥–∏–Ω–∏–≤—à–∏—Å—å –∫ –Ω–∞—à–µ–π –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–µ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ:

    • –ü—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç—å –∫–ª—é—á–µ–≤—ã–µ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ —Ä–∞–º–∫–∞—Ö —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã
    • –ü—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∏–∏ —Å —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è–º–∏ –∏ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç–∞–º–∏ –≤ –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç–∏ –ò–¢-–∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã
    • –û–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä—É –Ω–∞ —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è—Ö (–∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–∞—è, —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è, –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–Ω–µ–Ω—Ç–Ω–∞—è, —Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ—Ä—Ç—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è, —Å–µ—Ç–µ–≤–∞—è)
    • –°–æ–±–∏—Ä–∞—Ç—å, –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –∏ –Ω–µ—Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –∫ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è–º
    • –ü—Ä–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å —Å—Ä–∞–≤–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑, –æ—Ü–µ–Ω–∫—É –∏ –≤—ã–±–æ—Ä –∞–ª—å—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–∞—Ç–∏–≤ –≤ –∑–æ–Ω–µ –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏
    • –†–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –∏ —Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–æ–≤—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏—é –≤ —Ä–∞–º–∫–∞—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–∞ (–∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–∞, —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –¥–∏–∑–∞–π–Ω)
    • –ü—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç—å —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ –≤ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –∏ –ø—Ä–∏–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –±—ç–∫–ª–æ–≥–∞ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã

    –î–ª—è –Ω–∞—Å –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ:

    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –æ—Ç 3 –ª–µ—Ç –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–π, —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞–µ–º—ã—Ö —Å –Ω—É–ª—è
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫–æ–Ω–∞–≥—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–π –Ω–∞ –±–∞–∑–µ –º–∏–∫—Ä–æ—Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–Ω–æ–π –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã
    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–π –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ (Kubernates/OpenShift), –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π –∏—Ö –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏–π
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–µ–∫—Å–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π c –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º REST/SOAP-—Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–æ–≤, –æ—á–µ—Ä–µ–¥–µ–π, –±—Ä–æ–∫–µ—Ä–æ–≤ —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏–π, XML/JSON, XSD/JSON Schema
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å –Ω–µ—Ä–µ–ª—è—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–º–∏/—Ä–µ–ª—è—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–º–∏ –ë–î (–ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ, –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è, ACID, —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–∏ –∏–∑–æ–ª—è—Ü–∏–∏ –∏ —Ç. –¥.)
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –∏ —Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏
    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–æ–≤ –≥–∏–±–∫–æ–π –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ (scrum, kanban), –æ–ø—ã—Ç –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫
    • –ë–∞–∑–æ–≤—ã–µ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –æ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±—Å–ª—É–∂–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è (–≥–æ–ª–æ—Å–æ–≤—ã–µ —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç—ã, –∞—Å—Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç—ã, —á–∞—Ç-–±–æ—Ç—ã, IVR)
    • –ë–∞–∑–æ–≤—ã–µ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –≤ –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç–∏ VoIP —Ç–µ–ª–µ—Ñ–æ–Ω–∏–∏, –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–æ–∫–æ–ª–æ–≤ SIP, RTP, WebRTC
    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–æ–≤ –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–π DevOps
    • –ù–∞—Ü–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –Ω–∞ —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç –∏ –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å Jira, Confluence
    • –ù–∞–≤—ã–∫–∏ –ø–æ–¥–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∏ –∏ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø—Ä–µ–∑–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–π

    –ë–æ–ª—å—à–∏–º –ø—Ä–µ–∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º –±—É–¥–µ—Ç:

    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏—è (enterprise architecture)
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å–æ —Å—Ç—ç–∫–æ–º: Java 8/11, Spring/Springboot, OpenShift, PostgreSQL/Oracle, REST API, Kafka/MQ
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π –≤ –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç–∏ –∫–æ–º–º—É–Ω–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏ —Å –∫–ª–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–º–∏ –≤ –¥–∏–∞–ª–æ–≥–æ–≤—ã—Ö –∫–∞–Ω–∞–ª–∞—Ö (—á–∞—Ç—ã, —á–∞—Ç-–±–æ—Ç—ã, –≥–æ–ª–æ—Å–æ–≤—ã–µ –∞—Å—Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç—ã, –ø–æ–º–æ—â–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≤ –ö–¶)
    • –ü–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–æ–≤ –æ–±—Å–ª—É–∂–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –≤ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–∞–∫—Ç-—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö, –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã –ü–û
    • –ü—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ —Å–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—è—Ö —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ —Å–∏–Ω—Ç–µ–∑–∞ —Ä–µ—á–∏

    –ú—ã –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–∞–≥–∞–µ–º:

    • –û—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –æ—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤ —à—Ç–∞—Ç –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏: (–æ–ø–ª–∞—Ç–∞ –æ—Ç–ø—É—Å–∫–æ–≤ –∏ –±–æ–ª—å–Ω–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö –ª–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤);
    • –ö–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä–µ–Ω—Ç–Ω–∞—è –æ–ø–ª–∞—Ç–∞ —Ç—Ä—É–¥–∞, —É—Ä–æ–≤–µ–Ω—å –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–∞–µ–º —Å —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω—ã–º —Å–æ–∏—Å–∫–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–º
    • –ì—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã 5/2, –≥–∏–±–∫–∏–π –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥ –∫ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª—É —Ä–∞–±–æ—á–µ–≥–æ –¥–Ω—è.
    • –£–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã
    • –ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –æ–±–æ—Ä—É–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ
    • –ó–∞–±–æ—Ç—É –æ –≤–∞—à–µ–º –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤—å–µ: –î–ú–° —Å–æ —Å—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–µ–π –∏ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ä–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ –∫ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–µ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è. –¢–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞ Covid-19 –∫–∞–∫ –¥–æ–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–∞—è –º–µ—Ä–∞,
    • –†–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞ —Å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–æ–≤—ã–º–∏ –≤–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º–∏ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—è–º–∏ –≤ –±–∞–Ω–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–º —Å–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–µ.


  184. DevOps Tech Lead (AWS, Remote, USD) ("ClearScale", –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–∞) map[currency:USD from:4500 gross:true to:6400] [ 2021-08-19 ]
    ... the very foundation of the company, we work 100% remotely from various cities and countries. We work on a...

    ClearScale (headquartered in San Francisco, California, USA) - AWS Premier Consulting Partner has been offering a full range of professional cloud computing services for over 10 years, including architecture design, DevOps automation, refactoring and cloud-native applications development, integration, migration, solving all sorts of security issues (from just a security check to preventing cyber-attacks) and 24/7 technical support using the best advanced technologies.

    The list of our customers is diverse: from government companies (ClearScale is an official cloud partner of the State of California) and educational institutions (University of California, San Francisco) to well-known global brands (IBM, Samsung, GoPro, HP, Conde Nast, Carl Zeiss, etc.) The number of satisfied customers has been well over 850, some of which can be found on the company's website in the Case Studies section.

    • We were the third company to gain a new AWS competence: Applied AI and Machine Learning Operations (MLOps). Less than 15 partners have this competency!
    • We have confirmed status in the Database Freedom program (total less than 20 companies in)
    • Proven expertise as a Managed Services Provider (total less than 16 companies in). This means that ClearScale can perform a full cycle consultancy and service: from audits, system or software development to the 24/7. You can read more about us on the company page - Managed Services.

    Since the very foundation of the company, we work 100% remotely from various cities and countries. We work on a high trust basis within the company, therefore we do not monitor work being done via taking screen captures, webcams or log keyboard typing, as many other companies do. The professional reputation of our employees is of the highest value.

    Due to business growth, we are looking for new DevOps TL engineers who love finding solutions to interesting problems. Systems engineering division has a flat organizational structure where engineers collaborate in project groups.

    Job Responsibilities

    • Provide technical leadership for distributed DevOps engineering group;
    • Be responsible for the technical part of successful project delivery;
    • Establish effective communication and collaboration with the client and contractors; -- Analyze requirements and make/review estimates for scope of the work;
    • Create / specify / review architecture designs related to infrastructure and DevOps;
    • Provide tasks to DevOps engineers, check execution and quality standards;
    • Solve complex problems during project implementation;
    • Report to Systems Engineering director on a weekly basis;

    Required skills and experience

    -- Experience with AWS cloud platform: EC2, VPC, IAM, S3, ECS/EKS, RDS, Lambda and others;

    -- Experience with DevOps tools: CloudFormation/Terraform, Jenkins, Ansible and others;

    -- Hands-on experience with Linux/Windows, containers, databases, scripting;

    -- Solid understanding of the common challenges with migrations and modernizations, the ability to choose the right path based on previous experience;

    -- Experience of the full software development lifecycle: from requirements gathering and functional specification authoring to development, testing and delivery;

    -- Extensive experience working with large distributed infrastructures;

    -- Awareness about security standards (PCI DSS, HIIPA);

    -- Ability to work with distributed teams to provide technical guidance and leadership;

    -- Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate directly with peers, managers, and clients while leading the team;

    Desired Technical Certifications (not –∞ must)

    -- AWS Certified Solutions Architect Associate / Professional; -- AWS Certified SysOps Associate / DevOps Professional;

    What we offer

    # 1 Fair wage

    • Fixed hourly rate in USD
    • Full-time, 40 hours per week contract. It‚Äôs your main and permanent place of work, not a freelance job
    • Payments every 2 weeks
    • Annual Hourly Rate Review: received client's appreciation, obtained an AWS certificate, saved the world?The reward is based on facts, not on a personal attitude
    • Reference program: many engineers joined the team by the recommendation from their friends and former colleagues and we have a reward for this.

    # 2 Independence

    • from the office location or office conditions because it's only up to you where you want to work from - home, office, co-working or outdoors in the woods. The only requirement - fast and reliable internet. At the same time, our engineers do not work evenings or weekends: we focus on your local timezone
    • from any annoyance or big team buzz - we are the community of professional engineers, valuing each others' time and effort
    • from corruption and bureaucracy - we operate in an honest and competitive environment and we are one of the AWS's top 10 key partners.

    # 3 Professional Development

    • Work with innovative Silicon Valley companies and traditional American companies at the cutting edge of digital transformation
    • We work with the newest technologies in AWS cloud and open-source tools, Jira, Confluence, Lucidchart, Slack
    • Constant practice at writing and speaking in English
    • The team which is willing to share its experience
    • Paid AWS certification: we provide training material, paid time off and examination itself
    • Horizontal and vertical career growth - are you ready to be greater, faster, stronger? We keep growing and people keep growing with us
    • A nice bonus if you accept our offer quickly

    Response to vacancy via the form: https://skills.clearscale.com/sys login: candidate / password: $killmatr1x


  185. –ò–Ω–∂–µ–Ω–µ—Ä –≤–Ω–µ–¥—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è / –ò–Ω–∂–µ–Ω–µ—Ä Linux ("–ê–Ω–ª–∏–º–∏—Ç–µ–¥ –ü—Ä–æ–¥–∞–∫—à–µ–Ω", –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–∞) [ 2021-08-19 ]

    Unlimited eXpress

    –ù–∞—Å —É–∂–µ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ 100 —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫ –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ –∏ –∑–∞ –µ—ë –ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–∞–º–∏, –∞ –∫ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü—É 2021 –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–æ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å —É–∂–µ 200.

    –ú—ã –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—å —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—Ç –Ω–∞–¥ —É–ª—É—á—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –≤—Å–µ—Ö –∞—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—ã, —Å–ª–µ–¥–∏–º –∑–∞ —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–¥–∞–º–∏ –≤ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ, –Ω–µ –±–æ–∏–º—Å—è, –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–∞–≥–∞—Ç—å, –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–∞—Ç—å –∏ —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–æ–≤—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –Ω–æ–≤—ã–µ –¥–∞–∂–µ —Å–∞–º—ã–µ –±–µ–∑—É–º–Ω—ã–µ –∏–¥–µ–∏.

    –ß—Ç–æ –º—ã –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ–º

    –ü–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—É, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –∑–∞–∫—Ä–æ–µ—Ç 95% –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π —Å–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ –∫—Ä—É–ø–Ω—ã—Ö, —Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–∏—Ö –∏ –Ω–µ–±–æ–ª—å—à–∏—Ö –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–π.

    –ú—ã —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞–µ–º —É–¥–æ–±–Ω–æ–µ –∑–∞–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–æ–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ –¥–ª—è –æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—è, –∑–≤–æ–Ω–∫–æ–≤ –∏ —Å–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞, –≥–¥–µ –ª—é–±–∞—è –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—è –æ—Å—Ç–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –Ω–∞ –∫–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–º —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä–µ. –í –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∏–µ –æ—Ç –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏—Ö –∞–Ω–∞–ª–æ–≥–æ–≤, —Ç–∞–∫–∏—Ö –∫–∞–∫ Teams, Slack –∏–ª–∏ Telegram, –º—ã —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–ª–∏ —É–Ω–∏–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—É—é —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—é –¥–ª—è –≤–∑–∞–∏–º–æ–¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è —Å –∫–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–º–∏ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä–∞–º–∏ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–π-–ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–æ–≤, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è–µ—Ç –æ–±—â–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –º–µ—Å—Å–µ–Ω–¥–∂–µ—Ä, –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥—è—Å—å –Ω–∞ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä–∞—Ö, –∏ –¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å —É–Ω–∏–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ —Å–∫–≤–æ–∑–Ω—ã–µ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏.

    –ú—ã —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ–º –Ω–∞–¥ —Ç–µ–º, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –Ω–∞—à–∏ –∫–ª–∏–µ–Ω—Ç—ã —á–∞—Ç–∏–ª–∏—Å—å, —Å–æ–∑–≤–∞–Ω–∏–≤–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –∏ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–ª–∏ –≤ eXpress, –∞ –Ω–µ –¥—É–º–∞–ª–∏, –∫–∞–∫–æ–µ –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∏–º —É—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç—å –Ω–∞ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç —Ä–∞–∑.

    –°–µ–π—á–∞—Å –∏—â–µ–º –∫ —Å–µ–±–µ –≤ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—É –ò–Ω–∂–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∞ –≤–Ω–µ–¥—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è/–ò–Ω–∂–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∞ Linux, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å —Å —à–∏—Ä–æ–∫–∏–º —Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–æ–º —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–π, –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤ —Ä–∞—Å—Ç–∏(–≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–∏ –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø—ã –≤–Ω–µ–¥—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ –ê—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∞ –∏–ª–∏ –≤ –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–∏ Devops) –∏ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ —Å –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–æ–π.

    –ó–∞–¥–∞—á–∏:

    • –†–∞–∑–≤–µ—Ä—Ç—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏—è Express —É –∑–∞–∫–∞–∑—á–∏–∫–æ–≤(–ø–∏–ª–æ—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –≤–Ω–µ–¥—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è, –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–µ –æ—Ç–∫–∞–∑–æ—É—Å—Ç–æ–π—á–∏–≤—ã–µ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è);
    • –†–∞–∑–≤–µ—Ä—Ç—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å–æ–ø—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–µ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –¥–ª—è —Ä–µ–∑–µ—Ä–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∫–æ–ø–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ –º–æ–Ω–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥–∞;
    • –†–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ –∏ –∞–¥–∞–ø—Ç–∞—Ü–∏—è –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏;
    • –ö–æ–Ω—Å—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ü–∏—è –∏ –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫–∞ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤ –∑–∞–∫–∞–∑—á–∏–∫–æ–≤ –ø–æ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–Ω–æ–º—É –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏—é;

    –ü—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å —Å–æ —Å—Ç–µ–∫–æ–º:

    –†–∞–∑–Ω—ã–µ –¥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∏–±—É—Ç–∏–≤—ã Linux, c docker –∏ docker-compose, postgresql, nfs-server, ntpd, chronyd, iptables, ansible, nginx, haproxy, keep-alived, corosync, pacemaker, kafka, zookeeper, coturn, redis, Prometheus, Grafana, zabbix.

    –ù–∞—à–∏ –æ–∂–∏–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è –æ—Ç –∫–∞–Ω–¥–∏–¥–∞—Ç–∞:
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç –≤ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ –∏–Ω–∂–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∞ Linux –æ—Ç 2-—Ö –ª–µ—Ç;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã Docker –∏ Ansible;
    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å–µ—Ç–µ–≤—ã—Ö —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–π, –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä –∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–æ–∫–æ–ª–æ–≤;
    • –ù–∞—á–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–æ–∫–æ–ª–∞ SIP;
    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ LDAP —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä–æ–≤ –∫–∞—Ç–∞–ª–æ–≥–æ–≤: Microsoft Active Directory, Openldap;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å VMWare (ESX-ESXi), –∏–ª–∏ Microsoft Hyper-V;
    • –ë—É–¥–µ—Ç –ø–ª—é—Å–æ–º –æ–ø—ã—Ç –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π–∫–∏ iptables;
    • –ñ–µ–ª–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –∏ –ø—Ä–æ–±–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –Ω–æ–≤—ã–µ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç –ø–æ–¥–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–Ω–æ–π –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏;

    –ß—Ç–æ –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤—ã —Ç–µ–±–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–∏—Ç—å:

    • –º–∞—Å—à—Ç–∞–±–Ω—ã–π –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç: –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –∑–∞–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —à–∏—Ä–æ–∫–∏–º –∫—Ä—É–≥–æ–º –∑–∞–¥–∞—á.
    • —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã–µ –∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω—ã–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏: –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å —Å —à–∏—Ä–æ–∫–∏–º —Å—Ç–µ–∫–æ–º —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–π;
    • —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã: –ø–æ–ª–Ω–∞—è —É–¥–∞–ª—ë–Ω–∫–∞ –∏–ª–∏ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞ –≤ –æ—Ñ–∏—Å–µ(—à–∞–≥–æ–≤–∞—è –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –æ—Ç –º. –ù–æ–≤–æ—Å–ª–æ–±–æ–¥—Å–∫–∞—è); –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã 5/2; –æ—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ –¢–ö –†–§; –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –±–µ–ª–∞—è –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä–µ–Ω—Ç–Ω–∞—è –∑–∞—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω–∞—è –ø–ª–∞—Ç–∞;
    • –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ: –Ω–∞—Å—Ç–∞–≤–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ, –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–µ–µ –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–µ –∏–ª–∏ –≤–Ω–µ—à–Ω–∏–µ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏, –∫—É—Ä—Å—ã;
    • –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤—å–µ: –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏—Å–ø—ã—Ç–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å—Ä–æ–∫–∞ - –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø –∫ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–µ –î–ú–°.


  186. Senior Spark Data Engineer (remote) ("ClearScale", –í–æ—Ä–æ–Ω–µ–∂) map[currency:USD from:5000 gross:true to:] [ 2021-08-19 ]
    ... the very foundation of the company, we work 100% remotely from various cities and countries. We work on a...

    ClearScale (headquartered in San Francisco, California, USA) - AWS Premier Consulting Partner has been offering a full range of professional cloud computing services for over 10 years, including architecture design, DevOps automation, refactoring and cloud-native applications development, integration, migration, solving all sorts of security issues (from just a security check to preventing cyber-attacks) and 24/7 technical support using the best advanced technologies.

    The list of our customers is diverse: from government companies (ClearScale is an official cloud partner of the State of California) and educational institutions (University of California, San Francisco) to well-known global brands (IBM, Samsung, GoPro, HP, Conde Nast, Carl Zeiss, etc.) The number of satisfied customers has been well over 850, some of which can be found on the company's website in the Case Studies section.

    • We were the third company to gain a new AWS competence: Applied AI and Machine Learning Operations (MLOps). Less than 15 partners have this competency!
    • We have confirmed status in the Database Freedom program (total less than 20 companies in)
    • Proven expertise as a Managed Services Provider (total less than 16 companies in). This means that ClearScale can perform a full cycle consultancy and service: from audits, system or software development to the 24/7. You can read more about us on the company page - Managed Services.

    Since the very foundation of the company, we work 100% remotely from various cities and countries. We work on a high trust basis within the company, therefore we do not monitor work being done via taking screen captures, webcams or log keyboard typing, as many other companies do. The professional reputation of our employees is of the highest value.

    Job Overview

    ClearScale is looking for a Senior Spark Data Engineer to participate in building cost-efficient scalable data lakes for the wide variety of customers, from the small startups to the large enterprises.

    Usually, our projects fit into one of the categories (but not limited to them):

    • Collect data from the IoT edge locations, store it in the Data Lake, orchestrate processes to ETL that data, slice it into the various data marts. Then put those data marts into the machine learning or BI pipelines
    • Optimize pre-existing Spark clusters, find the bottlenecks in the code and/or architecture, plan and execute improvements
    • Build a data deliver pipeline to ingest high volume of the real-time streams, detect anomalies, slice into the window analytics, put those results in the NoSQL for the further dashboard consumption

    Responsibilities

    • Analyze, scope and estimate tasks, identify technology stack and tools
    • Design and implement optimal architecture and migration plan
    • Develop new and re-architecture solution modules, re-design and re-factor program code
    • Examine performance and advise necessary architecture changes
    • Communicate with client on project-related issues
    • Collaborate with in-house and external development and analytical team

    Description of candidate requirements

    ClearScale expects successful candidate to have most of the following qualifications and skills (not necessary all have to be presented):

    • Hands-on experience designing efficient architectures for high-load enterprise-scale applications or ‚Äòbig data‚Äô pipelines
    • Practical experience in implementing of micro-services architectures (using Python, Java or Scala stack)
    • Hands-on experience with message queuing, stream processing and highly scalable ‚Äòbig data‚Äô stores
    • Advanced knowledge and experience working with SQL and noSQL databases
    • Proven experience in re-design and re-architecting of the large complex business applications
    • Strong self-management and self-organizational skills

    • Successful candidates should have experience with any of the following software/tools (not all required at the same time):

      • Java/Scala/Python - strong knowledge
      • Graph databases development and optimization Neo4j, SPARQL, GREMLIN, TinkerPop, Pregel, Cypher, Amazon Neptune

      • Big data tools: Kafka, Spark, Hadoop (HDFS3, YARN2,Tez, Hive, HBase)
      • Stream-processing systems: Kinesis Streaming, Spark-Streaming, Kafka Streams, Kinesis Analytics
      • AWS cloud services: EMR, RDS, MSK, Redshift, DocumentDB, Lambda
      • Message queue systems: ActiveMQ, RabbitMQ, AWS SQ
    • We are looking for a candidate with 3-6 years of experience in Data, Cloud or Software Engineer role, who has attained a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field
    • Valid AWS certificates would be a great plus

    What we offer

    # 1 Fair wage

    • Fixed hourly rate in USD
    • Full-time, 40 hours per week contract. It‚Äôs your main and permanent place of work, not a freelance job
    • Payments every 2 weeks
    • Annual Hourly Rate Review: received client's appreciation, obtained an AWS certificate, saved the world?The reward is based on facts, not on a personal attitude
    • Reference program: many engineers joined the team by the recommendation from their friends and former colleagues and we have a reward for this.

    # 2 Independence

    • from the office location or office conditions because it's only up to you where you want to work from - home, office, co-working or outdoors in the woods. The only requirement - fast and reliable internet. At the same time, our engineers do not work evenings or weekends: we focus on your local timezone
    • from any annoyance or big team buzz - we are the community of professional engineers, valuing each others' time and effort
    • from corruption and bureaucracy - we operate in an honest and competitive environment and we are one of the AWS's top 10 key partners.

    # 3 Professional Development

    • Work with innovative Silicon Valley companies and traditional American companies at the cutting edge of digital transformation
    • We work with the newest technologies in AWS cloud and open-source tools, Jira, Confluence, Lucidchart, Slack
    • Constant practice at writing and speaking in English
    • The team which is willing to share its experience
    • Paid AWS certification: we provide training material, paid time off and examination itself
    • Horizontal and vertical career growth - are you ready to be greater, faster, stronger? We keep growing and people keep growing with us
    • A nice bonus if you accept our offer quickly


  187. –ö–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–π –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä / –ê—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º ("–ì–∞–∑–ø—Ä–æ–º –Ω–µ—Ñ—Ç—å", –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–∞) [ 2021-08-19 ]
    ...–±—Ä–∏–¥–Ω–æ–º —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–µ (—Å–æ–≤–º–µ—â–∞—Ç—å —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—É—é —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É –∏ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏ –≤ –æ—Ñ–∏—Å–...

    –ú—ã- –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞ —Ü–∏—Ñ—Ä–æ–≤–æ–π —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–∏ ¬´–ì–∞–∑–ø—Ä–æ–º –Ω–µ—Ñ—Ç–∏¬ª. –¶–∏—Ñ—Ä–æ–≤–∞—è —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—è - —ç—Ç–æ —á–∞—Å—Ç—å –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–µ–∫—Å–Ω–æ–π —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –Ω–∞—à–µ–π –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –º—ã –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏–º –¥–ª—è –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ü–µ–ª–µ–π —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–µ–≥–∏–∏-2030. –°–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è –≤ ¬´–ì–∞–∑–ø—Ä–æ–º –Ω–µ—Ñ—Ç–∏¬ª —É–∂–µ —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑—É—é—Ç—Å—è —Å–æ—Ç–Ω–∏ —Ü–∏—Ñ—Ä–æ–≤—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –ø–æ –≤—Å–µ–π —Ü–µ–ø–æ—á–∫–µ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è —Å—Ç–æ–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –∏ –æ–Ω–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–æ—Å—è—Ç –æ—â—É—Ç–∏–º—ã–π —ç–∫–æ–Ω–æ–º–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç. –£ –≤–∞—Å –µ—Å—Ç—å –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–∏—Å–æ–µ–¥–∏–Ω–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –∫ –ª—É—á—à–µ–π –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–µ –≤ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ –ö–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∞/ –ê—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∞ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º.

    –ï—Å–ª–∏ –≤—ã –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤—ã —Ä–µ—à–∞—Ç—å —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã–µ –∏ –º–∞—Å—à—Ç–∞–±–Ω—ã–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏ –≤ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–µ —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–æ–≤ ‚Äî –º—ã –∂–¥–µ–º –≤–∞—à–µ —Ä–µ–∑—é–º–µ!

    –õ–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏—è - –≥. –°–∞–Ω–∫—Ç-–ü–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–±—É—Ä–≥

    –ß–µ–º –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –∑–∞–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç—å—Å—è:

    • –†–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ —Ü–µ–ª–µ–≤–æ–π –∫–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–π –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã –±–ª–æ–∫–∞;
    • –§–æ—Ä–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π –∫ —ç–ª–µ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–º –ò–¢-–ª–∞–Ω–¥—à–∞—Ñ—Ç–∞;
    • –§–æ—Ä–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤, –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—è—é—â–∏—Ö —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫—É—é –ø–æ–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫—É –ö–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏;
    • –£—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ –≤ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–µ–≥–∏–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏—è –∫–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–π –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã;
    • –í—ã–±–æ—Ä –∏ –æ–±–æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–π, –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ–º—ã—Ö –Ω–∞ –ò–¢-–ª–∞–Ω–¥—à–∞—Ñ—Ç–µ;
    • –ü–æ–º–æ—â—å –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞–º –≤ –æ—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–ª–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –∫ –∑–∞—â–∏—Ç–µ –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–º –∫–æ–º–∏—Ç–µ—Ç–µ;
    • –ü–æ–º–æ—â—å –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞–º –≤ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–∏ —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π –∏ –∫–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç–æ–≤.

    –ù–∞—à–∏ —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è + —Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –ø–ª—é—Å–æ–º:

    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –∫–æ—Ä–ø. –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º (–∞–Ω–∞–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–Ω—ã–π) –∏–ª–∏ –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º –æ—Ç 3-—Ö –ª–µ—Ç;
    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ñ—Ä–µ–π–º–≤–æ—Ä–∫–∞ TOGAF;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–º–∏ –≤–∏–∑—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è (ARIS);
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º —Å —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω–æ–π –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–æ–π (–º–∏–∫—Ä–æ—Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å—ã, SOA, Event-Driven Architecture, Data Driven);
    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ –æ–ø—ã—Ç –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–æ–≤ DevOps –∏ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫ CI/CD;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç –≤–Ω–µ–¥—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã—Ö –∫–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º;
    • –í–ª–∞–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–º —è–∑—ã–∫–æ–º –Ω–∞ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ Intermediate;
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –≤ –ë–∞–Ω–∫–∞—Ö –∏–ª–∏ –≤ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è—Ö-–∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—Ö –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏—è—Ö: –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä, —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –Ω–µ –º–µ–Ω–µ–µ 2-—Ö –ª–µ—Ç- –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–µ–∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º

    –ú—ã –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–∞–≥–∞–µ–º:

    • –ò–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω—ã–µ, –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–µ–∫—Å–Ω—ã–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏ –≤ –∫—Ä—É–ø–Ω–æ–π –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏;
    • –ü–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫—É –æ–ø—ã—Ç–Ω–æ–≥–æ –Ω–∞—Å—Ç–∞–≤–Ω–∏–∫–∞ —Å –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–±–æ—á–µ–≥–æ –¥–Ω—è;
    • –ü—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∏ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏–µ;
    • –ì–∏–±–∫–∏–∏ÃÜ –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫ —Å –ø–ª–∞–≤–∞—é—â–∏–º –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–æ–º –∏ –æ–∫–æ–Ω—á–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º —Ä–∞–±–æ—á–µ–≥–æ –¥–Ω—è –∏ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å –≤ –≥–∏–±—Ä–∏–¥–Ω–æ–º —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–µ (—Å–æ–≤–º–µ—â–∞—Ç—å —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—É—é —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É –∏ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏ –≤ –æ—Ñ–∏—Å–µ);
    • –°–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–∏ÃÜ ¬´—É–º–Ω—ã–∏ÃÜ –æ—Ñ–∏—Å¬ª —Å –∫–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∫–∏–Ω–≥-–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º, –≤ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º –µ—Å—Ç—å –≤—Å–µÃà –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–∏ÃÜ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –∏ –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ—Ç–¥—ã—Ö–∞ –≤ –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Ä—ã–≤–∞—Ö;
    • –ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ –¥–ª—è —Ä–∞–∑–Ω–æ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã—Ö –∫–æ–º—å—é–Ω–∏—Ç–∏ ‚Äì –ø—Ä–∏—Å–æ–µ–¥–∏–Ω—è–∏ÃÜ—Å—è –∫ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞–º –ø–æ –ø–∞—Ä—É—Å–Ω–æ–º—É —Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç—É –∏–ª–∏ –∫–Ω–∏–∂–Ω–æ–º—É –∫–ª—É–±, —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–≤—É–∏ÃÜ –≤ –º–∏—Ç–∞–ø–∞—Ö PaaS Talks –∏–ª–∏ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–∏ÃÜ –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–∏ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ —Å–≤–æ–∏ÃÜ –∫—Ä—É–≥ –ø–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–∞–º –∏ –≤–æ–≤


  188. Senior Backend Developer ("–§—Ä–æ–Ω—Ç–±–∞–π—Ç", –ú–∏–Ω—Å–∫) [ 2021-08-19 ]
    ...–∞–∑–Ω—ã–µ –≤–∏–¥—ã —á–∞—è –í–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã 50% –æ–ø–ª–∞—Ç–∞ –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç–∏–...

    Frontbyte ‚Äî –Ω–æ—Ä–≤–µ–∂—Å–∫–∞—è –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è —Å –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–Ω—ã–º –æ—Ñ–∏—Å–æ–º –≤ —Å–∞–º–æ–º —é–∂–Ω–æ–º –≥–æ—Ä–æ–¥–µ –ö—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∏–∞–Ω—Å–∞–Ω–Ω. –ú–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∞—è –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞ Frontbyte –∑–∞–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–æ–π –º–æ–±–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –∏ –≤–µ–±-—Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π –¥–ª—è —Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∞, –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—è, —Ç–µ–ª–µ–∫–æ–º–∞ –∏ –±—É—Ö–≥–∞–ª—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–∏.

    –ò—â–µ–º –æ–ø—ã—Ç–Ω–æ–≥–æ backend-—Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –ø–æ–º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –Ω–∞–º –≤ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π –∏ –æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫–æ–º–ø–µ—Ç–µ–Ω—Ü–∏—è–º–∏ –º–æ—Ä—è–∫–æ–≤.

    –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏:

    • –†–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞ –≤ –º–µ–∂–¥—É–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥–Ω–æ–π —Å—Ä–µ–¥–µ –≤ —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∏–∏ —Å –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–æ–º SCRUM / Agile
    • –†–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–æ–≤ –∏ –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–Ω–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤
    • –†–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞ —Å –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞–º–∏ –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≤, —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–æ–≤ –∏ DevOps
    • –£—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ –≤ code review –∏ –æ–±—â–∏—Ö –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∞—Ö.

    –¢—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è:

    • –ù–µ –º–µ–Ω–µ–µ 3 –ª–µ—Ç –æ–ø—ã—Ç–∞ –≤ –∫–æ–º–º–µ—Ä—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å-–æ—Ä–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–π
    • –û—Ç–ª–∏—á–Ω–æ–µ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ .NET Framework –∏ C#
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å MS SQL –∏ NoSQL
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å ASP.Net WebAPI
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å RestAPI, WebSockets
    • –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –∞—Å–∏–Ω—Ö—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è
    • –•–æ—Ä–æ—à–µ–µ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ –º–æ–¥—É–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤ –Ω–∞ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ TDD/BDD
    • –ü–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã –º–∏–∫—Ä–æ—Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–æ–≤
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–æ–π –Ω–∞ –±–∞–∑–µ –∫–ª–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –∏ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä–æ–≤
    • –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è ORM (EntityFramwork, Nhibernate)
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç –≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è application logging
    • –°—Ç—Ä–µ–º–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∫ –∏–Ω–∂–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–Ω–æ–º—É –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π
    • –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —è–∑—ã–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ Intermediate –∏ –≤—ã—à–µ.

    –ë—É–¥–µ—Ç –ø–ª—é—Å–æ–º:

    • –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏ Microsoft IIS
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å Microsoft Azure
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å .Net Core
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å Docker
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å big data –∏ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏—Å—Ç–∏–∫–æ–π
    • –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–∏–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è .Net (dotMemory, dotTrace)
    • –û–ø—ã—Ç –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è.

    –ü–æ—á–µ–º—É –º—ã:

    • –û—Ç—Å—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ –±—é—Ä–æ–∫—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–∏ –∏ –≥–∏–±–∫–∏–π –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥ –∫ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ
    • –°—Ç–∞–±–∏–ª—å–Ω–∞—è –∑–∞—Ä–ø–ª–∞—Ç–∞ —Å –ø—Ä–∏–≤—è–∑–∫–æ–π –∫ –µ–≤—Ä–æ
    • –°—Ç–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –æ—Ñ–∏—Å –≤ —Å–∞–º–æ–º —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–µ –≥–æ—Ä–æ–¥–∞ (–ë–¶ ‚Äú–†–æ—è–ª –ü–ª–∞–∑–∞‚Äù), –ø–æ–ª–Ω—ã–π —Ö–æ–ª–æ–¥–∏–ª—å–Ω–∏–∫ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–∫—É—Å–æ–≤, –∫–æ—Ñ–µ–º–∞—à–∏–Ω–∞ –∏ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã–µ –≤–∏–¥—ã —á–∞—è
    • –í–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã
    • 50% –æ–ø–ª–∞—Ç–∞ –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç–∏–π –≤ Skyeng
    • –û—Ç–ø—É—Å–∫ - 25 —Ä–∞–±–æ—á–∏—Ö –¥–Ω–µ–π –≤ –≥–æ–¥
    • –ê–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–∞—è –∫–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–∞—è –∂–∏–∑–Ω—å
    • –î—Ä—É–∂–Ω—ã–π –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤ –∏ –≤–∑–∞–∏–º–Ω–∞—è –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫–∞.


  189. Senior ML Engineer ("Grid Dynamics", –°–∞—Ä–∞—Ç–æ–≤) [ 2021-08-19 ]

    We are looking for someone who is a technology-agnostic polymath, committed to a lifelong journey of continuous learning and exploration of innovative scientific ideas and will bring thoughtful perspectives, empathy, creativity, and a positive attitude to solve problems at scale. This role is ideal for someone looking to extend their algorithm design and software engineering skills into a part mentor, part IC, part thought partner role.

    Responsibilities:

    • Architect, build, maintain, and improve new and existing suite of algorithms.
    • Utilize your entrepreneurial spirit to identify new opportunities to optimize business processes and improve consumer experiences, and prototype solutions to demonstrate value with a crawl, walk, run mindset.
    • Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for data analyses, model development, validation, and implementation.
    • Mentor and educate team members to adopt best practices in writing and maintaining production machine learning code.
    • Actively contribute to and re-use community best practices.
    • Develop and test ML models using Python/Keras/Tensorflow/Spark stack.
    • Communicate with business stakeholders to clarify their requirements and present the teamwork results.

    Requirements:

    • University or advanced degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics, or a related field.
    • 5+ years of experience developing and deploying machine learning systems into production.
    • Strong experience working with a variety of relational SQL and NoSQL databases.
    • Strong experience working with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch, Spark MLLIB, etc.
    • Experience with at least one cloud provider solution (AWS, GCP, Azure).
    • Strong experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, R, C++, Scala, etc.
    • Experience with Platforms like H2O, Sage maker, MLFlow, Anaconda, etc.
    • Ability to quickly prototype ideas and solve complex problems by adapting creative approaches.
    • Strong knowledge of data pipeline and workflow management tools.
    • Relevant working experience with Docker and Kubernetes is a big plus.
    • Experience in working across different global cultures a plus.
    • Good communication skills and interpersonal skills.

    We offer:

    • Opportunity to work on bleeding-edge projects
    • Work with a highly motivated and dedicated team
    • Flexible schedule
    • Medical insurance
    • Benefits program
    • Corporate social events
    • Professional development opportunities

    About us:

    Grid Dynamics is the engineering services company known for transformative, mission-critical cloud solutions for retail, finance, and technology sectors. We architected some of the busiest e-commerce services on the Internet and have never had an outage during the peak season. Founded in 2006 and headquartered in San Ramon, California with offices throughout the US and Eastern Europe, we focus on big data analytics, scalable omnichannel services, DevOps, and cloud enablement.


  190. Infrastructure Engineer (DevOps, Python) - Disaster Management ("–ö–æ–Ω—Ç—É—Ä–Ω—ã–µ –∫–∞—Ä—Ç—ã", –ú–∏–Ω—Å–∫) map[currency:USD from:2500 gross:false to:4000] [ 2021-08-18 ]

    Kontur is looking for an Infrastructure Engineer for its work-from-home team.

    We are a US company that develops a geospatial analytics platform that uses innovative mapping technologies to provide visual, location-aware intelligence across business verticals. For many regions across the globe, natural disasters are not just news headlines ‚Äî they are the reality of life. We are helping companies, governments, and communities reduce the impact of natural disasters and provide help and resources to those who need them the most.

    Duties and responsibilities

    As part of the back-end team, you will be working with product development, spatial data analysts, and front-end developers to design, implement and deploy resilient data processing pipelines, APIs, and tools to serve in-house and client users. You will be solving the challenges of bringing together many online geospatial data sources, transforming and managing them in the system and presenting resulting intelligence to the consumers.

    As a Back-end Engineer, you will take responsibility for parts of the Kontur Platform and applications built to use it. You may need to go outside the Java ecosystem to implement data solutions with SQL, Bash, or Python scripts.

    Our technology stack includes Java, MyBatis, Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, GNU Make, Python, Osmium, pgRouting, OSRM. We deploy to a hybrid cloud environment with Docker and Gitlab CI/CD.

    Why would you want to join?

    • Technical challenge. You will be participating in framework development, data engineering, and programming geospatial components.
    • Unmatched expertise. You will be working alongside GIS community leaders, seasoned tech visionaries, entrepreneurs, engineers, and tech leaders with decades of experience.
    • Helping people. Our solutions are already being used by organizations, such as Pacific Disaster Center, Beacon NGO, and Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team, in real cases of natural and human-made disasters. Knowing that the feature you have been working on saves lives is priceless.
    • Flexibility. We believe that only in a comfortable and safe environment we perform at our best. That‚Äôs why we have a flexible schedule and avoid overtime work. The healthy and friendly atmosphere in the company is something we truly value and are proud of.

    Things we seek

    • Substantial experience in architecting and developing CI/CD solutions.
    • Experience in scripting languages, such as Python, Bash.
    • Expertise in automating deployments, config management.
    • Knowledge of the core engineering concepts, data structures, algorithms, and best practices.
    • Experience in AWS (ElasticSearch, RDS, EC2, S3, Lambda, etc.).
    • Experience in DB administration, Postgres as a plus.
    • An understanding of modern deployment and integration practices, experience managing applications in both development and production environments.
    • Ability to communicate fluently in English both verbally and in writing.

    Things that will set you apart

    • Experience with Geospatial domain.
    • Strong Linux background.
    • Prior backend development experience.


  191. Backend-—Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫ (Java/Kotlin) ("–ü–æ—á—Ç–∞ –ë–∞–Ω–∫", –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–∞) [ 2021-08-18 ]
    ...∏ —Å–∞–º–æ–æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è + –Ω–∞–ª–∏—á–∏–µ —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–∞. –û–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ - –¥–æ—Å...

    –ß–ï–ú –ú–´ –¢–£–¢ –ó–ê–ù–ò–ú–ê–ï–ú–°–Ø:

    –†–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞–µ–º –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—É –º–æ–±–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç- –±–∞–Ω–∫–∞ (–¥–∏—Å—Ç–∞–Ω—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –±–∞–Ω–∫–∏–Ω–≥) –Ω–∞ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ –º–∏–∫—Ä–æ—Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–æ–≤ –≤ —Å–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–º —Å—Ç–µ–∫–µ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–π, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –º—ã –≤—ã–±–∏—Ä–∞–µ–º —Å–∞–º–∏. –°–µ–π—á–∞—Å –Ω–∞—à –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç –∑–∞–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç –ª–∏–¥–∏—Ä—É—é—â–∏–µ –ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏–∏ –≤ —Ä–µ–π—Ç–∏–Ω–≥–∞—Ö, –º—ã –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ –∏–Ω–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä—É–µ–º –≤ –µ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏–µ –∏ –Ω–µ –æ—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–∞–≤–ª–∏–≤–∞–µ–º—Å—è –Ω–∞ –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∏–≥–Ω—É—Ç–æ–º. –ù–∞—à–∏–º –¥–∏—Å—Ç–∞–Ω—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–º –±–∞–Ω–∫–∏–Ω–≥–æ–º –ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –±–æ–ª–µ–µ 7 –º–ª–Ω. —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫, –µ–¥–∏–Ω–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ —Å –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–Ω—ã–º –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—Ç –±–æ–ª–µ–µ 10000 –∫–ª–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –ë–∞–Ω–∫–∞. –ö–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π –∏ –Ω–∞–≥—Ä—É–∑–∫–∞ –ø–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–Ω–æ —Ä–∞—Å—Ç—É—Ç ‚Äì –∑–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª—ã–π –≥–æ–¥ –Ω–∞–≥—Ä—É–∑–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—É —É–≤–µ–ª–∏—á–∏–ª–∞—Å—å –≤ 3 —Ä–∞–∑–∞.

    –¢–ï–•–ù–û–õ–û–ì–ò–ß–ï–°–ö–ò–ô –°–¢–ï–ö:

    –Ø–ü –∏ —Ñ—Ä–µ–π–º–≤–æ—Ä–∫–∏: Java 8/11, Kotlin (–ø–æ –∂–µ–ª–∞–Ω–∏—é), Spring Boot, Apache Camel.

    –•—Ä–∞–Ω–∏–ª–∏—â–∞ –∏ –æ—á–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∏: Redis, Apache Cassandra, Oracle 12, ActiveMQ, IBM WS MQ.

    DevOps & CI: Apache Maven, Jenkins, GitLab, Docker + Kubernetes (–≤–Ω–µ–¥—Ä—è–µ–º —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å).

    –ú–æ–Ω–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥: Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana, Sentry (–≤–Ω–µ–¥—Ä—è–µ–º —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å), Zabbix.

    –ß–¢–û –í–´ –ë–£–î–ï–¢ –î–ï–õ–ê–¢–¨:

    • –†–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –º–∏–∫—Ä–æ—Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å—ã –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—ã –¥–∏—Å—Ç–∞–Ω—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –±–∞–Ω–∫–∏–Ω–≥–∞.
    • –†–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—é –º–æ–±–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ –≤–µ–±- –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–∞–º–∏ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—ã –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–º–∏ —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞–º–∏ –ë–∞–Ω–∫–∞.
    • –†–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–Ω—ã–µ —Å—Ö–µ–º—ã —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–æ–≤ –∏ –≤—ã–±–∏—Ä–∞—Ç—å —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏ –¥–ª—è —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –Ω–æ–≤—ã—Ö –∏ –Ω–µ—Ç—Ä–∏–≤–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–∞–¥–∞—á (–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ —Å –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º –∏ –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–æ–º).
    • –í—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω—è—Ç—å —Ä–µ–≤—å—é –∫–æ–¥–∞, –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–º–∏ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∞–º–∏, –∏ –æ–±—É—á–∞—Ç—å –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—é—â–∏—Ö —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–æ–≤.

    –ë–£–î–£–©–ò–ô –†–ï–ó–£–õ–¨–¢–ê–¢ –í–ê–®–ï–ô –†–ê–ë–û–¢–´:

    –ù–∞–±–æ—Ä –º–∏–∫—Ä–æ—Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–æ–≤ –¥–ª—è –Ω–æ–≤—ã—Ö —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π –º–æ–±–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç-–±–∞–Ω–∫–∞. –û–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ç—Ä–µ–±—É–µ–º–æ–≥–æ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –∫–æ–¥–∞, —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –µ–≥–æ –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è, –æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±–ª—è–µ–º—ã—Ö –∫–æ–¥–æ–º —Ä–µ—Å—É—Ä—Å–æ–≤.

    –ú–´ –û–ñ–ò–î–ê–ï–ú –û–¢ –í–ê–°:

    • –ü–∞—Ä—É –ª–µ—Ç –æ–ø—ã—Ç–∞ –≤ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–µ –Ω–∞–≥—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö RESTful —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–æ–≤.

    –í "–ü–û–ß–¢–ê –ë–ê–ù–ö–ï" –ú–´ –ü–†–ï–î–õ–û–ñ–ò–ú –í–ê–ú:

  192. Associate Architect / Architect DevOps Engineer ("ZiMAD", –°–∞–Ω–∫—Ç-–ü–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–±—É—Ä–≥) [ 2021-08-17 ]

    About the challenge

    Do you love solving challenging technical problems at scale?
    Are you a process-focused individual, passionate about working in a high growth & highly rewarding cross-functional DevOps environment?
    Cloudways is looking for an experienced and world class Technical Architect who will play a vital role in taking the Cloudways Platform to the next stage.

    What will you do?

    • Get involved in the architecture planning, implementation, and maintenance of server clusters, API, and microservices, including critical production environments in hybrid cloud
    • Collaborate with the product team to explore the technical scope of the needs of customers
    • Use proven architecture design and best practices to make sure that the applications remain always-available, offer sustained high performance and are scalable on demand
    • Monitor incidents/problems trends to identify areas of deficiency and recommend improvements to prevent future occurrences
    • Bridge the gap between business/user problems and technology solutions/possibilities
    • Brief the teams and stakeholders on the structure, characteristics, behavior, and related aspects of the solutions
    • Create and publish Architecture and Application Availability Metrics (through general and team-specific dashboards)
    • Research emerging technologies and propose changes to the existing architecture to ensure compatibility with proven technologies.
    • Lay out execution plans with proper control over the solution development process & environment
    • Collaborate with development teams to optimize architecture performance, rightsize environments, provide constructive feedback/coaching, and review code

    You definitely have:

    • Proven expertise in managing large-scale deployments of traffic-intensive applications
    • Experience in automating cloud system monitoring and operations through scripting
    • Hands-on experience in administering high availability and high-performance environments
    • In-depth knowledge and 5+ years of hands-on experience with Linux
    • Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related technical field
    • Excellent understanding of Scalability processes and techniques
    • Expert knowledge of at least one Infrastructure-as-Code / Configuration-as-Code technology (such as Terraform, Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Salt)
    • Good understanding of platform and systems‚Äô architecture ‚Äì modular monoliths and microservices. Operational knowledge of enabling tools such as Kubernetes and Dockers is a plus point.
    • Working knowledge of modern DevOps processes including monitoring, log aggregation, alerting, service discovery.
    • System troubleshooting and problem-solving across platform and application domains. You will be expected to participate in on-call escalations to troubleshoot issues
    • Operational understanding of Agile methods
    • Fluent English level

    We propose:

    • Competitive salary
    • Full Time Permanent but 100% Remote Job
    • Internet allowance
    • Two yearly bonuses
    • Paid Time Off
    • Paid Disability Leaves up to 12 months
    • International trip
    • Learning and development budget
    • 5 days in a week and 6 days during last week of month, 8+1 daily working hours.


  193. Middle Data Scientist (remote) ("ClearScale", –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–∞) map[currency:USD from:4000 gross:true to:] [ 2021-08-17 ]
    ... the very foundation of the company, we work 100% remotely from various cities and countries. We work on a...

    ClearScale (headquartered in San Francisco, California, USA) - AWS Premier Consulting Partner has been offering a full range of professional cloud computing services for over 10 years, including architecture design, DevOps automation, refactoring and cloud-native applications development, integration, migration, solving all sorts of security issues (from just a security check to preventing cyber-attacks) and 24/7 technical support using the best advanced technologies.

    The list of our customers is diverse: from government companies (ClearScale is an official cloud partner of the State of California) and educational institutions (University of California, San Francisco) to well-known global brands (IBM, Samsung, GoPro, HP, Conde Nast, Carl Zeiss, etc.) The number of satisfied customers has been well over 850, some of which can be found on the company's website in the Case Studies section.

    • We were the third company to gain a new AWS competence: Applied AI and Machine Learning Operations (MLOps). Less than 15 partners have this competency!
    • We have confirmed status in the Database Freedom program (total less than 20 companies in)
    • Proven expertise as a Managed Services Provider (total less than 16 companies in). This means that ClearScale can perform a full cycle consultancy and service: from audits, system or software development to the 24/7. You can read more about us on the company page - Managed Services.

    Since the very foundation of the company, we work 100% remotely from various cities and countries. We work on a high trust basis within the company, therefore we do not monitor work being done via taking screen captures, webcams or log keyboard typing, as many other companies do. The professional reputation of our employees is of the highest value.

    About the role

    ClearScale is looking for an individual who performs a Machine Learning Developer or Data Scientist role. The successful candidate should demonstrate the ability to build, train, tune, and deploy machine learning (ML) models.

    About the project

    ClearScale is running various projects closely related to Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence and Internet Of Things.
    One of the projects is aiming at creation of valuable insights and forecasts for stock market investors and traders based on companies fundamentals, contracts data, news feed sentiment. It requires strong expertize in neural networks, NLP and various ML algorithms.
    Others include recommendation engines for e-commerce companies as well as for public/private educational organizations.
    These projects either startups started from the scratch either bring completely new techniques to the mature businesses.

    Responsibilities

    • Select and justify the appropriate ML approach for a given business problem
    • Identify appropriate AWS services to implement ML solutions
    • Design and implement scalable, cost-optimized, reliable, and secure ML solutions
    • The ability to express the intuition behind basic ML algorithms
    • Experience with ML and deep learning frameworks
    • Create data repositories for machine learning
    • Identify and implement a data-ingestion solution
    • Identify and implement a data-transformation solution
    • Sanitize and prepare data for modeling
    • Perform feature engineering (missing and unbalanced data, outliers)
    • Analyze and visualize data for machine learning
    • Train machine learning models
    • Perform model tuning (learning rate, regularization techniques), hyperparameter optimization
    • Evaluate machine learning models
    • Apply basic AWS security practices to machine learning solutions
    • Deploy and operationalize machine learning solutions

    Requirements

    • Bachelor or Specialist/Masters in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field
    • 2+ years of experience in Machine Learning/Data Science applications (classical and deep learning models, ensemble learning)
    • 2+ years of experience in Python ML frameworks (NumPy, SciPy, scikit_learn, Pandas, Jupyter, Matplotlib)

    Would be a plus

    • Knowledge of ANSI SQL (ability to write advanced analytical queries)
    • In-depth knowledge in one or more Machine Learning areas: Deep Learning, NLP, Recommender Systems, Reinforcement Learning
    • In-depth knowledge of Tensorflow/Keras
    • In-depth knowledge of AWS SageMaker and one or more of the following related algorithms: Linear Learner, XGBoost, Seq2Seq, DeepAR, BlazingText, Object2Vec, Object Detection, Image Classification, Semantic Segmentation, Random Cut Forest, Neural Topic Model, Latent Dirichlet Allocation, K-Nearest-Neighbors, K-Means, Principal Component Analysis, Factorization Machines, IP Insights, Reinforcement Learning, Automated Model Tuning
    • In-depth knowledge of one or more of the following AWS technologies: S3, Glue, RDS, Aurora, Athena, EMR, SageMaker, Ground Truth, Comprehend, Translate, Transcribe, Polly, Rekognition, Forecast, Lex, Personalize, Textract.
    • Hands-on experience with Apache Spark MLLib (Zeppelin)
    • Hands-on experience with OpenCV
    • Hands-on experience with advanced Python data frameworks (Seaborn, PyTorch, Dask)

    Valid AWS certificates would be a great plus (not a must):

    • AWS Certified Solutions Architect ‚Äì (Associate / Professional)
    • AWS Certified DevOps Engineer ‚Äì (Professional)
    • AWS Certified SysOps Administrator ‚Äì (Associate)
    • AWS Certified Developer ‚Äì (Associate)

    What we offer

    # 1 Fair wage

    • Fixed hourly rate in USD
    • Full-time, 40 hours per week contract. It‚Äôs your main and permanent place of work, not a freelance job
    • Payments every 2 weeks
    • Annual Hourly Rate Review: received client's appreciation, obtained an AWS certificate, saved the world?The reward is based on facts, not on a personal attitude
    • Reference program: many engineers joined the team by the recommendation from their friends and former colleagues and we have a reward for this.

    # 2 Independence

    • from the office location or office conditions because it's only up to you where you want to work from - home, office, co-working or outdoors in the woods. The only requirement - fast and reliable internet. At the same time, our engineers do not work evenings or weekends: we focus on your local timezone
    • from any annoyance or big team buzz - we are the community of professional engineers, valuing each others' time and effort
    • from corruption and bureaucracy - we operate in an honest and competitive environment and we are one of the AWS's top 10 key partners.

    # 3 Professional Development

    • Work with innovative Silicon Valley companies and traditional American companies at the cutting edge of digital transformation
    • We work with the newest technologies in AWS cloud and open-source tools, Jira, Confluence, Lucidchart, Slack
    • Constant practice at writing and speaking in English
    • The team which is willing to share its experience
    • Paid AWS certification: we provide training material, paid time off and examination itself
    • Horizontal and vertical career growth - are you ready to be greater, faster, stronger? We keep growing and people keep growing with us
    • A nice bonus if you accept our offer quickly


  194. Senior UI React Developer (Remote in Poland) ("ClearScale", –ü–æ–ª—å—à–∞) map[currency:USD from:6000 gross:true to:7000] [ 2021-08-17 ]
    ...lopers collaborate in project teams. We work 100% remotely from various cities and countries. We trust eac...

    About

    ClearScale LLC (headquarters: San Francisco, CA, USA) - AWS Premier Consulting Partner, has been offering a full range of professional cloud computing services for more than 10 years, including architecture design, DevOps automation, refactoring and cloud-native application development, integration, migration, and support using the best-advanced technologies.

    Our team of 100 + certified architects, engineers, and developers has serious experience in successful projects.

    We help large Fortune 500 companies, midsize businesses, and Silicon Valley startups successfully implement ambitious and complex cloud projects to become industry leaders.

    Due to the growing new needs in the company, we are looking for a new Frontend developer who likes to find solutions to interesting problems and to participate in various AWS-hosted development projects. Implementation will employ the stack based on Java/Spring. Application architecture will be designed using a variety of AWS services and SDKs.

    The Development application division has a flat organizational structure in which developers collaborate in project teams. We work 100% remotely from various cities and countries. We trust each other, so do not take screenshots of the screen, do not look through webcams, and do not track printing on the keyboard, as many others do. The professional reputation of engineers and developers in our community is of the highest value.

    About the role

    ClearScale is looking for a seasoned (senior-level expected) Frontend, Developer to participate in an AWS-hosted SaaS platform development project.

    Implementation will employ the stack based on React/Vue HTML5/Bootstrap with Java/Kotlin backend. Application architecture will be designed using a variety of AWS services and SDKs.

    You will become part of a mid-sized distributed engineering team that is responsible for preparing infrastructure, designing application architecture, implementing and stabilizing program code, running load tests, optimizing performance, and providing operational support.

    Responsibilities

    • Implement and maintain frontend applications for AWS-hosted multi-tenant SaaS platform, analyze requirements and figure out implementation solutions and tooling
    • Work on UI mockups, review, and clarify functional stuff. Suggest best/practical UX. Collaborate with the UI design team
    • Write and document program code, collaborate with QA team on code stabilization
    • Examine code performance and advise necessary infrastructure and design changes
    • Collaborate with team lead, in-house and external development, and analytical teams
    • Take an active part in delivery/sprint planning procedures, estimate task duration and ETAs.

    This position will report to TL, Director of Development, and PMs.

    Required skills and experience

    • ClearScale expects the successful candidate to have most of the following qualifications and skills (not necessary all have to be presented):

      1. We are looking for a candidate with 7+ years of hands-on experience as frontend/senior frontend developer‚Äôs role with a focus on custom software development projects
      2. Hand-on experience designing modern, interactive and cross-browser layouts for complex web applications, using React/Vue frameworks
      3. Practical experience building adaptive and responsive web apps, and web apps for mobile devices
      4. Expert level in HTML/CSS/XML/JS and TypeScript
      5. Fundamental understanding of usability principles, how interface building guidelines work, and how to deal with UI kits
      6. Knowing how to work with wireframing tools (e.g., InVision, Figma)
      7. Strong self-management and self-organizational skills working in a remote environment
      8. Experience with Configuration/Content Management System of multi-tenant SaaS platform
      9. Ability to carry on English communication in emails and chats with customers. The ideal candidate has fluent English to maintain technical calls with the US teammates
      10. Understanding of fundamental software development lifecycle stages (e.g. requirements, design, development, testing, delivery) and processes
      11. Successful candidates should demonstrate any of the following (not all required at the same time):
        1. Certain background working with Design Systems
        2. Participation in UI Kit design projects
        3. Working with unclear requirements and focus on delivery

    You‚Äôll be a great fit if

    • You are able to be collaborative, adaptive, flexible and have a strong leadership and communication skills
    • You love being a part of a small, dynamic, and agile team that encourages you to learn and grow
    • You desire to work with some of the world‚Äôs top brands
    • You love finding solutions to interesting problems and figuring out how things work
    • You welcome having autonomy with complex tasks
    • You are passionate about using your experience and expertise to inspire the team

    We offer

    • High compensation paid;
    • Completely remote work: we trust our employees to work from anywhere they please;
    • Very flexible schedule consisting of 40 hours per week, Slack for communication;
    • Bureaucracy-free environment;
    • We adore change-makers and creators so you'll be able to influence our processes;
    • Highly skilled project teams that consists of senior level professionals;
    • Wise projects rotation including ML, Big Data, IoT, fintech and healthcare;
    • Paid AWS certifications and internal education
